title: 2005–06 Segunda Divisão
text:
The 2005–06 <a href="Segunda%20Divis%C3%A3o">Segunda Divisão</a> season was the 72nd season of the competition and the 56th season of recognised third-tier <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Portugal">Portugal</a>.
Overview.
The league was contested by 58 teams in 4 divisions with <a href="CD%20Trofense">CD Trofense</a>, <a href="AD%20Lousada">AD Lousada</a>, <a href="UD%20Oliveirense">UD Oliveirense</a> and <a href="CD%20Olivais%20e%20Moscavide">CD Olivais e Moscavide</a> winning the respective divisional competitions and progressing to the championship playoffs. The overall championship was won by <a href="CD%20Olivais%20e%20Moscavide">CD Olivais e Moscavide</a> and the runners-up <a href="CD%20Trofense">CD Trofense</a> were also promoted to the <a href="Liga%20de%20Honra">Liga de Honra</a>.

Final.
The final was played on 28 May 2006 in <a href="Marinha%20Grande">Marinha Grande</a>.
